text: hello guys could some one help me in deep linkung my app from the html anchor tag

Well, what is the error then?
i dont see any error..even..
But you said the app is closing? So there should be a stacktrace, no?
PackageManager: Failure retrieving resources for my app package name

before doing this i have added ``` <data
                    android:host="notification"
                    android:scheme=“customschema" />```
and just sent sms to my mobile haveign link like “ <customschema://notification>” which opens the app perfectly

so i did the same thing through my html page with anchor href=“ <customschema://notification>"
but dont worked..
did you try different browsers?
no i am just opening it the webview of different app
That might be your issue then. If the other app uses `shouldOverrideUrlLoading` and doesn’t let the system handle the URL, then it won’t work

<@U04TK850N>: what should i do then ? in shouldOverrideUrlLoading
Well if the other app is yours, you can check if the URL matches the one you registered you can just return false and let the system handle it.
Check the docs: _„return true means the host application handles the url, while return false means the current WebView handles the url.“_
And in the same paragraph: _by default WebView will ask Activity Manager to choose the proper handler for the url_
help  <http://stackoverflow.com/q/37132505/5870896>

In the Android M permissions, is the permissions denied as default? or is there a not denied, not granted default
not granted as default
but not explicitly denied?
yeah, it’s denied as default.
there are only 2 state Permission_Granted and Permission_denied
so by default it will be Denied
granted, denied and “always denied"
always denied is that exist? or its same as never asked again?
yeah, that’s never ask again denied

scrollview or nestedscrollview

if you use a nestedscrollview and the root is a coordinatorlayout it all works together
that way you can have complex views above the recycler that slide up and off or whatever look you want/need
